glosses: to play, amuse oneself, fool around
to dance; to gambol, cavort, frisk about
to fluctuate, move back and forth, flicker
to risk, play around with, trifle with
to monkey with, tinker with, tamper with

etymology:
From Ottoman Turkish اوینامق (oynamak, “to play, perform, risk, disport, move, vibrate, dance, amuse one's self, jest”), from Old Anatolian Turkish اوینامق (oynamak), from Proto-Turkic *oyna-; equivalent to oyun (“game”) + -a- (denominal verb suffix).
Cognates
Cognate with Karakhanid [script needed] (oynāmāk, “to play”), Old Turkic [script needed] (oyna-, “to play”), Azerbaijani oynamaq (“to play”), Bashkir уйнау (uynaw, “to play”), Kazakh ойнау (oinau, “to play”), Khakas ойнирға (oynirğa, “to play”), Kyrgyz ойноо (oynoo, “to play”), Turkmen oýnamak (“to play”), Uyghur ئوينىماق (oynimaq, “to play”), Uzbek oʻynamoq (“to play”), Yakut оонньоо (oonňoo, “to play”).
